intro: Rhynchosia adenodes var. cooperi, commonly known as the Cooper's crownflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
